poem:
Leaving Neverland Again  

In the shadows, echoes linger—  
fragile voices in a world of glittered sin;  
truth unwinds like thread,  
over dim decades, ten years deep,  
chasing whispers through legal labyrinths.  
Lawyers' eyes, paper-thin,  
see only shadows on walls;  
truth stands bare,  
an unbroken note,  
hanging in the air.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. This follow-up film delves into their 10-year legal journey to get Jackson’s estate to accept their claims that they were abused, while lawyers share insights. The documentary ends on an astonishing note,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
